column2: When granting provinces in which you also own minor holdings (e.g., after holy war), you may either preserve the county's capital or, whenever you can, switch the capital holding to a city. Note that you may revisit this decision by skipping provinces. How would you like to grant?
Republican: Prefer to make a city the county capital
Give it to a random, new [Root.Culture.GetAdjectiveCap] noble
Grant the province §Y[target_province.GetName]§! to my [This.GetFromRelation] and councillor ([This.GetJobTitle]), §Y[This.GetTitledName]§!.\n
Grant the province §Y[target_province.GetName]§! to my councillor ([This.GetJobTitle]), §Y[This.GetTitledName]§!.\n

For each recently-acquired county in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, you will be prompted about whether to automatically distribute its titles. You may individually skip any such province in the process, leaving manual management of the province to you. Duchies will never be automatically granted.

For each recently-acquired county in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, you will be prompted about whether to automatically distribute its titles. You may individually skip any such province in the process, leaving manual management of the province to you. Duchies will never be automatically granted.
This province has been recently acquired and qualifies for automatic land distribution.
